title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Covid Clinic (Corte Madera, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Easy , spoke with recruiter have a job the next day. I think they hire anyone. I’m not sure if it’s still open the best of luck. COVID swabbing all day out of a van
Interview Questions: Why this job ? How many hours can you work per week? Are you vaccinated question?

title: Recruiting Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Covid Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Fast.Short. New company - fast growing. Managed 16 recruiters nationwide. Interview was detialed behavioral interview format. Non Profit Medical Company. Fast.Short. New company - fast growing. Fast.Short. New company - fast growing.
Interview Questions: Work life balanace mean to me?

title: COVID TESTER Interview
Interview Descriptions: easy asked me 2 questions abot my previous job experience and what was the reason for looking a new job and also just looked at my resume and got hired
Interview Questions: previous job duties and how can you use them at this site?

title: EMT/CNA - Clinical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Covid Clinic (San Jose, CA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen from a work-at-home person. She was quite nice. However, later, on the hiring managers call she seemed to have a combative attitude from the get-go. The manager's interview was a red-flag for me, so I said I'm not your guy - bye.
Interview Questions: Are you available (e.g. to work off hours)?

title: Recruiter Interview
Interview Descriptions: Interview was as expected basic questions. Interviewer was nice and had an enjoyable conversation. The call was on time lasted about 20 minutes. Also the position was remote and was a huge plus/
Interview Questions: Explain a time you had difficulty sourcing?

title: EMT-B Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Covid Clinic (San Jose, CA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Screening phone calls from someone working from home. A few days later a call was set up by the previous screener. That call was transferred to the hiring manager.

The screener was quite polite, the hiring manager, not so much.
Interview Questions: The kicker was "are you available to work weekends and holidays?"

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Covid Clinic (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Good interview. Simple questions, very nice and asks about past jobs. They will ask you to explain a certain situation that could help with the job. Very friendly and allowed to ask questions at the end
Interview Questions: How would you be a good addition to the team? What is your passion?

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Covid Clinic (San Bernardino, CA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview. Interview went pretty easy and smooth, I was told my responsibilities and asked a few common scenario questions. Completed live scan and few other tests since I would be working for a school district
Interview Questions: What would you do if there was  incorrect patient information entered into the system after the patient had left?

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Covid Clinic (Castro Valley, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy and fast. Female called me out of the blue after submitting my resume. She asked simple questions about what kind of job I'm looking for and then admitted it was an interview. She said I did great despite my novice responses.
Interview Questions: Are you vaccinated and can you pass a drug test

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Interview Descriptions: It was surprisingly fast. They reached out to me for the position and then contacted me for the interview on the same day I said that I was interested in the position. It lasted 15-20 minutes and the abruptness took me off guard. All the questions were relevant to the position including the hypothetical questions. It seemed fair to me, however it was fast.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you saw your coworker wearing their PPE gear improperly?

title: EMT-B Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Covid Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, they called two weeks later and essentially asked when I could start and if my availability was open. They had me send files of my certifications and fill out some info online.
Interview Questions: Do you have a pulse and can you work whenever  we ask you to?

title: Site Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Covid Clinic (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy.  Did not ask many questions. Over the phone. The interviewer asked basic questions regarding availability and work history.  After the interview, received an offer email.  Started work a week after that.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Tell me about your work history.

title: Physician Substitute (AEMT) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Covid Clinic (Curl Tex Colonia, TX) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: uncoordinated none English speaking interviewers. they will set up a time and never call you. I had to call 6 times to finally get a reply. Once I did talk to someone the person could barely speak English
Interview Questions:
Do I have certs
what are strengths/weakness
